COVID-19 is a new infectious disease caused by Coronavirus. It is a respiratory virus that spreads through an infected persons sneeze, cough or speech. It can also spread through surfaces an infected person has been in contact with.

Common symptoms of COVID-19 are fever, dry cough and tiredness. Less common symptoms are aches and pains, sore throat, diarrhea, headaches and loss of taste or smell. Serious symptoms are difficulty breathing or shortness of breath, chest pain and loss of speech or movement.
The following information are some tips and precautions you can take to reduce the chances of getting and spreading COVID-19.
Washing your hands regularly with soap and water. Using alcohol-based sanitisers to keep your hands clean.
Wearing a mask reduces the spread of the virus as they can prevent you coughing on others.
Stay 1.5 metres from others when outside and avoid shaking hands, kissing or hugging other people.
Stay at home unless you are leaving to do an essential activity.
